# Analysis of Discord Chat in "⚡│general"

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is very brief, containing only a few messages discussing Multi-Controller Protocol (MCP) approaches. CheddarQueso shared a link to a Twitter/X post, which ash commented on, noting that similar approaches were being explored mid-last year but seemed to hit limitations. ash suggests that development on MCP may have slowed, and predicts new approaches might emerge, specifically mentioning direct Blender harnesses as a possibility. .hyp shaman then briefly mentioned that "skills" are becoming the new trend, sharing a link to skillsmp.com.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What might replace MCP approaches that have hit limitations? (asked by ash) A: "Skills" might be the new meta, with resources available at skillsmp.com (answered by .hyp shaman)

## 3. Help Interactions
No significant help interactions were present in this brief chat segment.

## 4. Action Items
No explicit action items were mentioned in the chat.
